recipes.name: Masaledar Sem (Spicy Green Beans)
method: Blend ginger and garlic with 1/2 cup of water until smooth.
Heat oil in a saucepan, add cumin seeds, and stir for half a minute.
Add the ginger-garlic paste and cook for about two minutes.
Add the coriander and stir a few times.
Add chopped tomatoes, stir and cook for 2 minutes.
Add beans, salt, and one cup of water. Simmer.
Cover and cook for 8-10 minutes until beans are tender.
Add lemon juice and freshly ground pepper.
Turn up the heat to boil away the remaining liquid.

recipes.name: Vegetable Kurma
method: Heat oil in a vessel and fry cinnamon, cloves, and cardamom for 2-3 minutes.
Add onions and green chilies and fry until onions turn brown.
Add garlic and ginger paste, fry for a minute.
Add vegetables and fry for about 3 minutes.
Add water and cook the vegetables with turmeric powder.
Add coconut paste, khus-khus, and salt. Cook on low heat until done.

recipes.name: Vegetable Curry
method: Mix garlic, coriander, chili powder, and salt. Set aside.
Heat oil in a pan, add mustard seeds and urad dal. Let mustard seeds split.
Add onions and fry until brown.
Add vegetables, spice mixture, and crushed tomatoes.
Cook for 5 minutes if using canned vegetables. Otherwise, cover and cook for 10-15 minutes.

recipes.name: Green Pepper Curry
method: Cut the green peppers, onion, and tomatoes lengthwise.
Grind chili powder, turmeric, dhania powder, coconut, and poppy seeds.
Heat oil, add vadium, and fry until brown.
Add onions and fry for 4 minutes.
Add tomatoes and fry for 2 minutes.
Add green pepper and masala. Cook on low heat for around 15 minutes.

recipes.name: Dry Potatoes (Sookha Aloo)
method: Boil potatoes until cooked but not overdone. Peel and cut into 1/2-inch cubes.
Heat oil very hot, add and brown cumin seeds.
Add potatoes and fry until golden brown.
Add the remaining spices and fry for 3-4 minutes.

recipes.name: Curried Mushrooms
method: Wash and finely slice mushrooms. Slice onion finely.
Heat oil, add turmeric and onions. Fry until soft.
Add the sliced tomatoes and cook for 3 minutes, stirring all the time.
Add the mushrooms, cover, and simmer for 15-20 minutes.
Remove cover and dry out all the water.
Serve hot.

recipes.name: Okra (Bhindi)
method: Wash the okra and dry it thoroughly.
Cut off the heads and cut into small circles.
Chop the onions and tomatoes separately.
Deep fry the okra until very brown.
Remove from heat and set aside. Pour out some oil.
Add turmeric to hot oil. Add the onions and fry until golden brown.
Add the fried okra, salt, pepper, and tomatoes.
Cover and bake at 250°F for 15 minutes.

recipes.name: Cauliflower and Potatoes (Aloo Gobi)
method: Make masala with onion, garlic, ginger, and tomatoes.
Add turmeric and spices.
Break the cauliflower into florets and cut the potatoes into cubes.
Add both to masala and lower heat to simmer.
Cover the pot until the cauliflower and potatoes are cooked.

recipes.name: Curried Eggplant (Bhartha)
method: Preheat oven to 450°F.
Bake the eggplants in the oven for 1 hour or until very tender.
While they are still warm, peel and crush the eggplants.
Heat oil and fry onions until soft and clear.
Add the tomatoes and fry for 2 minutes.
Add the eggplant and stir until almost all liquid disappears.
Place into a bowl, sprinkle on coriander and serve at once.

recipes.name: Sambhar
method: Boil the toor dal with 3 cups of water.
Fry channa dal, dhania seeds, hing, and red chilies.
Grind the mixture with water.
Fry the green pepper in oil for a few minutes.
Boil the tamarind paste, water, salt, turmeric, tomato, and vegetables.
Add the ground mixture and cook for 5 minutes.
Add boiled dal and bring it to a boil.
Fry the mustard seeds and onion. Add to the mixture.

recipes.name: Masur Dal (Lentils)
method: Wash the dal and drain it.
Boil water and add the dal, salt, pepper, turmeric, chopped ginger, and garlic.
Cover and simmer for 20 minutes.
Heat the ghee, add the cumin, and fry until golden brown.
Add thinly sliced onions. Fry until crisp and brown.

recipes.name: Mah Ki Dal (Whole Black Beans)
method: Clean, wash, and add the dal to boiling water.
Add turmeric, salt, half of the finely chopped ginger, garlic, and cook.
Cook further in the same pan on low heat for half an hour.
Heat the ghee, add remaining ginger, stir, add sliced onions, chili, and fry until golden brown.
Add cumin or coriander (optional). Pour over dal just before serving.

recipes.name: Red Kidney Beans (Rajma)
method: Wash beans and boil for 2-3 hours or half an hour in a pressure cooker.
Make masala of onions, garlic, ginger, and tomato.
Add to the beans and cook until most of the liquid dries up and the beans are soft.
Garnish with coriander leaves and serve.

recipes.name: Curried Garbanzo Beans
method: Clean, wash, and soak the beans overnight.
Boil them in the same water with salt, chopped onion, garlic, ginger, and cloves.
Simmer in a pan for an hour or until tender, or pressure cook for 7 minutes.
Heat oil. Fry thinly sliced onions and garlic. Cook until mixture browns and dries up.
Add chopped tomatoes and cook for 4-5 minutes more.
Add the beans and cook for 10 minutes more.
Add mango powder and pomegranate seeds, grated ginger, and simmer over low heat for 15-20 minutes.
Before serving, pour sizzling ghee over the beans.

recipes.name: Onion and Tomato Raita
method: Beat yogurt and milk until smooth.
Chop the onion and tomato and add to the yogurt.
Add salt and pepper, and sprinkle the Chat Masala on top.
Serve chilled.

recipes.name: Boondhi Raita
method: Make a pouring paste of the besan and water.
Heat ghee and drop the paste into it through a slotted spoon to form small droplets (boondhi).
Fry the boondhi until golden brown and drain on a paper towel to remove excess oil.
Soak the boondhi in warm water.
Mix milk, salt, pepper, and Chat Masala into the yogurt.
Squeeze water out of the boondhi and add to the yogurt mixture.
Serve chilled.

recipes.name: Mint and Coriander Chutney
method: Wash and soak tamarind in water for half an hour.
Clean, pick, and wash the coriander and mint leaves.
Extract the pulp from the tamarind and squeeze out the juice.
Grind coriander, mint, green chili, and onion into a fine paste.
Add the tamarind pulp and salt, and blend well.
Store in an airtight jar and refrigerate for up to one week.
